member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.SetStylePresets(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarStylePreset,Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarPresetNextPrevFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configure appearance related properties of the calendar using predefined values.

remarks.p: If the ViewState is enabled, then a call to this method will result in significant increase of the hidden-view-state-field size passed to the client.
To avoid increased size of the view-state,- the desired style-preset should be set at visual design.

member.param: Preset style. It includes colors, fonts, borders, images, etc.
Format of the buttons that perform navigation to the next-previous months. To keep old values, the "CalendarPresetNextPrevFormat.NoChange" value should be used.
An option to reset old appearance-related properties.

The default value for this property is Auto which will detect the client browser and renders the output deemed appropriate for that browser.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.JavaScriptFileNameCommon
member.summary: Name of the file that contains the external JavaScript with common methods for client-side functionality on up-level browsers such as IE5, Netscape6.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the name of the common external JavaScript file.
If application uses any other instance of any Infragistics Web control, then values of that property in all controls should match, otherwise, client-side functionality in all controls may fail.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.ImageDirectory
member.summary: Directory in which the images used for the tabs are stored.

remarks.p: The string specified as the ImageDirectory will be prefixed onto the image related properties.
Note that is a particular file-image-name starts with the ".", "/", "\\" character or contains the ":" character, then that file-name will be used as it is without the ImageDirectory prefix.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of names for event function handlers used by JavaScript on client side.
member.remarks:
Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in returning information from the server, WebMenu implements both client-side events and server-side events. You can choose whether you would like to respond to client-side events, which must be implemented through JavaScript. The CalendarClientSideEvents object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.
Every event function handler should have 3 parameters (the InitializeCalendar has only 1 parameter). The first parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents UltraWebTab.
The second parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Tab.
The third parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Event.
Look at the events description for details.

This event can be canceled.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarStylePresets

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarStylePresets.Preset(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar,Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarStylePreset,Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarPresetNextPrevFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Configure properties of target according to predifined style.
Note: all properties of target related to the appearance will be reset.
If this method is called at run time, then the size of the hidden ViewState field passed to the client will be significantly increased.
member.param: Instance of the WebCalendar, which properties will be modified.
True: reset old properties related to appearance.

summary.p: The ClientSideEvents object contains string properties that allow client-side JavaScript function names to be specified for handling a variety of events that occur on the client. The JavaScript function with the same name must then be defined somewhere within the page in order for the event to be fired.
The JavaScript can be written directly into the aspx page or it can be added in the code-behind file using the Page.RegisterClientScriptBlock function.
The InitializeCombo event will fire after the Client-Side Object Model has been created.
The ValueChanged event will fire when the value of the dropdown is changed. If the textbox is changed directly, this event will not fire until the control loses focus.
The TextChanged event will fire when the textbox portion of the control is directly edited.
The BeforeDropDown event will fire before the dropdown is made visible. This event can be used to cancel the dropdown action.
This event will fire after the control has droped down. You can use this event to customize the position of the dropdown.
This event will fire for every keydown, while the edit portion of the control has focus.
This event will fire for every keyup, while the edit portion of the control has focus.
This event will fire before the dropdown portion of the control is closed. You can use this event to keep the dropdown from closing.
This event will fire after the dropdown has been closed.

summary.p: The WebDropDown control is a multi-column, editable drop-down selection control. It allows users to choose values from a displayed list of items that is shown when the arrow in the control is clicked.
The drop-down area of WebDropDown is based on the WebGrid control and supports many of the features of it. Column and row sizing, sorting, row selectors are supported within the drop-down.
If values in addition to the list are possible for the field, the WebDropDown can be set to Editable so that values can be directly typed in to the top value of the control.
WebDropDown can also be used from within WebGrid to display valuelists inside of grid cells.

member.summary: Determines if the Combo control allows values to be typed in

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not the HTML is rendered in a compact format that is less readable but which optimizes page download time.
When this property is set to true, extra spaces, tabs and line feed characters are not used in the rendered html.

summary.p: Returns the ExpandEffects object that determines the type of filters and transitions that will be used when displaying sub menus under IE 5 and above.

The ClientSideEvents object maintains the names of JavaScript functions that are to be called on the client side in response to various events that can be processed without the need for a server post-back.
Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not Select dropdown controls will be automatically hidden when submenus are being displayed.
When this property is set to true, all select controls in the page document are hidden until the popup menus are dismissed.

remarks.p: This functionality is necessary due to the problematic way that Internet Explorer implements the Select DropDown control. Netscape 6+ handles this situation properly and the hiding of dropdowns is not necessary.

summary.p: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that WebDropDown exposes.

member.summary: This event is fired when the DateChooser encounters an invalid date. This event can be fired after a postback, or during the Page_Load.
member.remarks: You can use this event to handle invalid date entries made.

member.name: E:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.CalendarVisibleMonthChanged
member.summary: The CalendarVisibleMonthChanged event will fire each time the Calendar's month is changed. You can control whether this event will generate a postback automatically by setting the respective property.
member.remarks: Note: This event WILL be fired if the year is changed, but the month name remains the same.

summary.p: The BrowserTarget can be set to force all clients to use the same renderer, regardless of Browser Capabilities.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.AllowNull

summary.p: Determines if the edit portion will accept a blank as a valid value.

member.remarks: If AllowNull is set to false and the Value of the Control is null, the date of the switch will be placed into the Value of the control.

summary.p: Sets whether the dropdown portion of the control will initially be visible when the page is loaded.
Determines whether the dropdown will automatically close after a date has been selected from the calendar.
Determines the alignment of the dropdown with the edit portion of the control: left, center, right.
Returns the ExpandEffects object, which controls any special effects used when dropping down the control.

remarks.p: The ExpandEffects reqire the browser to support Transitions and Filters which are only available in IE5 and up.

summary.p: Returns the set of properties which control the Button portion of the control.

Determines if the user can directly edit the value by typing into the edit portion of the control. When this property is false, the value may still be changed by selecting days from the dropdown, or using arrow keys.

Determines if the user can change the selected date. When ReadOnly is true, the date chooser is not editable, and you will not be able to dropdown the calendar, making it impossible to change the value of the control.
Determines the format used when converting the DateTime value, into its textual representation.
Determines whether other dropdowns on the page should be hidden, to prevent them from displaying over the calendar dropdown.

remarks.p: If a dropdown (Html Select element) is located in the same screen area where the Calendar will be displayed, it is possible for the Html Select element, to be drawn on top of the Calendar. In order to fix this drawing problem, this property should be set to true.

summary.p: Determines the upper date limit that can be entered.

remarks.p: When a date is entered that is past the MaxDate, a DateOutOfRangeException is thrown at design time. At runtime, an InvalidDateEnteredEvent is fired.

summary.p: Determines the lower date limit that can be entered.

remarks.p: When a date is entered that is lower than the MinDate, a DateOutOfRangeException is thrown at design time. At runtime, an InvalidDateEnteredEvent is fired.

summary.p: The text displayed in the edit portion of the control, when the is null.
Reflects the ImageDirectory property for the embedded default WebCalendar control
The relative path to the JavaScript file used by the Calendar.
The relative path to the JavaScript file used by the DateChooser.
The relative path to the common javascript file, shared by all Infragistics Web Controls.

remarks.p: By default, this file should have the relative path "/ig_common/20051/scripts/ig_shared.js".

summary.p: The text representation of the DateTime .

remarks.p: This property is read-only and is created dynamically according to .

summary.p: The DateTime value of this input control.

remarks.p: The value specified here should either be a DateTime , a convertable string representation of a DatTime, or null (DBNull).

summary.p: Used to specify client side event handlers.
The CustomCalendar can be used to customize the calendar that is dropped down.

remarks.p: The value specified here must implement the ICalendar Interface and have a base class of System.Web.UI.Control.

summary.p: The collection of properties for the Calendar portion of this control.

remarks.p: Note that properties SelectedDate and VisibleMonth have no effect. The MaxDate, MinDate and some others can be overridden by similar properties of WebDateChooser.

summary.p: The style applied to the Calendar's container, when dropped down.
The style applied to the input portion of the control. This style can be used to customize the text color, font, etc.
This property controls the postback behavior of each ServerSide Event.

remarks.p: Setting the individual memebers to true, will force a postback to occur as soon as the corresponding event occurs on the client.

Setting the member to false will prevent postbacks from occuring when the event occurs. Instead, the event will only be fired after a postback is generated by some other means, such as a clicking a "submit" button.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.EnableKeyboardNavigation
member.summary: Enables the user to utilize the keyboard to navigate the Calendar control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDate
member.summary: The InvalidDate enum describes why a date value could not be set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDate.DateOutOfRange
member.summary: The date value was not between the control's min and max dates.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDate.NullValue
member.summary: A null value was specified, but AllowNull is set to false.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDate.ImproperDateFormat
member.summary: The string could not be converted into a valid date.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDateEventArgs
member.summary: InvalidDateEventArgs holds information about a date that could not be set, including the reason why.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDateEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.InvalidDate,System.String,System.Object)

summary.p: This constructor is used to create a new InvalidDateEventArgs, when the InvalidDateEvent is fired.

member.param: The code specifying why the date was invalid.
If the was ImproperDateFormat, this will be the original date string, otherwise it will be null.
If the was DateOutOfRange or NullValue, this will be the original DateTime, otherwise it will be null.

summary.p: If the was ImproperDateFormat, this will be the original date string, otherwise it will be null.
If the was DateOutOfRange or NullValue, this will be the original DateTime, otherwise it will be null.
The code specifying why the date was invalid.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.WebDateChooserEventArgs
member.summary: Event argument object for WebDateChooser Events

summary.p: This event is fired after the DateChooser has been completely initialized on the Client, and is ready for processing.
Occurs when the control is losing focus. This event can be used to get the value of the DateChooser, after user input has stopped.
This event is fired when an invalid value has been entered into the DateChooser.

remarks.p: This event will be fired for 3 distinct cases. The first case would be a date entered that is non in the range of MinDate - MaxDate values set for the control. The second case would be when a null value is entered, but AllowNull is set to false. The last case would be an improperly formatted date string. This could occur of the month "13" was entered, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarDateClicked
member.summary: Event fired when the selected date was clicked.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarMonthChanged
member.summary: Event fired after the visible month was changed.

remarks.p: Note: This event WILL fire when the year is changed, even if the Month Name remains the same.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarMonthChanging
member.summary: Event fired before the visible month was changed. This event is cancelable.

remarks.p: Note: This event WILL fire when the year is changed, even if the Month Name remains the same.

summary.p: This event is fired after the Calendar's SelectedDate has been changed.
This event is fired before the Calendar's SelectedDate has been changed. This event can be cancelled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarRenderDay
member.summary: This event will fire for each day shown in the calendar.
member.remarks: This includes "OtherMonthDays", which aren't part of the VisibleMonth. This event can be used to customize the appearance of any specific day in the calendar.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserAutoPostBack.ToString
member.summary: String formatted for visual designer.

summary.p: Setting this property to true will cause a postback to occur, each time the DateChooser's value is changed on the client.
Setting this property to true will cause a postback to occur each time the Calendar's month is changed on the client.
